channel.title: Computer Science
channel.description: Today, I went to a College Fair, which showcased many different colleges in or near my state. I took a look at many different colleges that offer a Computer Science course, but I came to realize that Math would be essential in these courses. I was wondering if anyone here is currently taking going for this major or would like to pursue this in the future. Also, does anyone have a general idea of what type of Math courses in high school are required/essential for Computer Science?

item.title: Computer Science
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

I love math, all the courses that you need to take have already been posted. Try writing a Math API in a language of your choice, it can be quite fun, and it helps you understand the formulas more thoroughly.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Science
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

The only reason I ask is because I’ve slacked off in Math ever since my Freshman year; however, it isn’t because I don’t like it, because I actually think it is quite fun if you understand the steps required to solve a particular problem.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Science
item.dc:creator: @m.dog311 m.dog311
item.description:
@m.dog311 wrote:

I’m looking at going into software engineering, and I’m currently taking Calc 1 in my senior year, and I took basic statistics last year.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Science
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Depends on what you’re going into. Either way, math and computer theory go hand-in-hand, so it’s only natural to pair them. Take as many math and logic courses that you can (while still staying relevant to computer theory) if you want to be as cool as possible.

Or don’t…

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Science
item.dc:creator: @the_elve_age the elve age
item.description:
@the_elve_age wrote:

I’m planning to major in some type of Engineering, I love math and always will. I actually visited a college fair today also and I’ve been thinking a lot about Technology schools. I would take as many math courses as you can in High School. Why? Its simple, you won’t be paying for in college, other math courses that you do take in college will come somewhat faster, and you won’t have to study the basics as hard. Right now I’m taking Calculus in HS and I’ll be taking calc again in college.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Science
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

Computer Science and Software Engineering both require a lot of mathematics. I am pursuing Software Engineering and only getting to the point of Analytic Geometry/Trigonometry in high school, leading into Calculus and Physics courses in college. It is recommended to take Calculus courses.

Try looking up your college and finding a Course Index or Recommended Courses page. They will generally give you a list of recommended courses.

You won’t escape math in Computer Science or a programming major.

Read full topic

item.title: Computer Science
item.dc:creator: @Tutorial Tutorial
item.description:
@Tutorial wrote:

RiiPiiNFtW:

Algebra, Trig and sometimes Calculus depending on the type of applications you are going to create.

Do you use those fields in an advanced way? If so, I will need to take a Math course also.

Read full topic
